content: @Attila Vasas - What are you looking for in a discussion about porting organic groups? Are you looking for help? Did you just want to see if there was interest?

To me, I suppose the question that are relevant would be:
1) Is this an important enough suite of modules that we should be making a special effort to encourage it being ported?
2) If it's that important, why hasn't it been ported already? Is it just to complex?
3) Are there other complex modules that should be ported but are not getting ported on their own?

@StPaulTim I want to see if there is interest and I am looking for help if my conclusion is true (from my issue):

I think this requires in-depth expertise in core programming also. We should find an expert who can port this module.

An average porting programmer can use only one "tool": A description on Backdropcms.org about the converting. It is not enough for OG module. Can anybody continue my unfinished porting?

These are my thoughts on your questions:
1) I guess yes. I think we need Organic Group module too, if we want to captivate the D7 users. It is included in the list of top 125 modules (by @docwilmot ): https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/34
2) I think the problem is the complexity. Consider the number of D7 users of OG, and the OG module is the dependecy of other modules.
3) I think yes, and we should file an issue at backdrop-ops/contrib if we find a too compex (and important) module for an average porting programmer.

How are we doing so far? · Issue #34 · backdrop-ops/contrib
Drupal 7.x modules list by most installed (top 125): (thought it would be nice to see what's missing - we're not doing too bad!) Key: Unported Ported In core or replaced Modules: Views (par...
@Attila Vasas it would help if you could run the code through coder upgrade, and start a repo in Backdrop contrib.

I got at least that far recently: https://github.com/laryn/og

laryn/og
Contribute to laryn/og development by creating an account on GitHub.

Then stalled here for now: https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/entity_plus/issues/32

Entity Views · Issue #32 · backdrop-contrib/entity_plus
@hosef It looks like somewhere along the way the views folder got chopped out. I was trying to do a quick-and-dirty "Coder Upgrade" on organic groups just as a test, but it looks like it ...

@docwilmot I worked a lot on porting OG module, my conclusion: https://github.com/backdrop-ops/contrib/issues/420

Port request for Organic groups · Issue #420 · backdrop-ops/contrib
Name of the module, theme, or layout Organic groups Link to the drupal.org module, theme, or layout https://www.drupal.org/project/og It is a very useful module, but I couldn't convert it: http...

It's exciting to see movement on Organic Groups for Backdrop CMS.
https://github.com/laryn/og/issues

laryn/og
Contribute to laryn/og development by creating an account on GitHub.
@Laryn - I'm testing again now.
@Laryn ++
laryn thanks for all you do (Karma: 1)
@StPaulTim Are you interested in taking a crack at the role ID issue?
Checking now
Sure, I'll try now.
Just restarting my test, but only enabling og and og_ui to see if that works better.
Yeah that's what I've mostly been doing, at least to start. But the role ID fix may be needed in submodules too.

OK, I'm working on that issue. Not sure how equipped I am for it, but I'll post progress reports and questions here:
https://github.com/laryn/og/issues/5

Tips welcome.

Also - if I'm blocking anything else and someone can do this quicker, feel free to jump in.

Convert role ID query to use CMI · Issue #5 · laryn/og
In various places, queries and references to "role ID" need to be converted to work with Backdrop's CMI. For example: https://github.com/laryn/og/blob/1.x-2.x/og.module#L2687 @stpault...
@Laryn I won't be able to test again until tonight. Thanks for your work.

@Laryn Indeed, thanks for porting Organic Groups. Just started testing, here's a first issue: https://github.com/laryn/og/issues/16. I've not much time these days but I'm eager to do more testing.

Admin people view missing · Issue #16 · laryn/og
On the OG settings page admin/config/group/settings, there is a list to select "the View that should be used to show and control the people in the group". As far as I know, it should be t...
Thanks! I have a PR in process that may resolve a bunch of the issues. I can post back here when it's ready for more testing.

@Olaf Grabienski @Attila Vasas @StPaulTim Ready for further testing. Some issues are still open but there should be major progress. I've closed a few issues -- reopen if you see it as still a problem.
I wasn't able to test last night. But, looking forward to checking out progress today.
@Laryn - I'm watching progress with excitement, but just don't have time to help right now. I wish I did. I will get back in the queue as soon as possible.
@Laryn I'm also eager to help! :)

Just started over to test https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/og, following http://modulesunraveled.com/organic-groups-7x-2x, chapters "2. Organic Groups Setup" and "3. Organic Groups Views". Went fine so far, only smaller issues.
